About Me

Oh hey...nice to meet you

BIO

When I’m not binging on Schitt’s Creek or The Good Place you can most likely find me with a pizza in my mouth or up in the mountains. (Sometimes both)
I like taking long road trips if not only to help me get through the hours and hours of backlogged podcasts in my queue.
My highest achievement so far in life is probably when I ran into Matt Damon in an elevator at The Grove Hotel in Boise, Idaho. After we shook hands he said, ‘Whoa, nice handshake’.

Always Learning

My belief is that no one is truly a master of anything. There’s always room to from, more things to learn and facilitating details in the ordinary. Because of this type of belief system I get to learn new things everyday (which you would think would be helpful for pub trivia on Wednesdays) and gain experience in areas that offer growth on different levels.

Humans === Computers

Way back before the Myspace days of hacking into html to make your page look fresh af, I was always interested in the interactions with technology. Not being smart enough to create anything and not having an artistic skill in design left me somewhere in the middle between of all things ‘interwebby’. Funnily enough, that’s the position most of us find ourselves in everyday which launched me into a world of support (just restart your computer, mom) and user experience.

Pizza Preferences

What makes a good pizza? Is it the crust? The toppings? The wood used to cook it?
All good questions, but each in itself leaves out the most important part of eating pizza. Pizza is all about the experience. When in Chicago, you go deep dish. When in New York, you go big and wide (looking at you Grimaldi’s) When you’re at a pub, you go small and flakey. As long as where you are, you’re having a pie that represents the moment, sharing it with good people and making it more of an experience than a meal…that’s the best pizza.
